source.3bda1565:
import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
source.ded1df89:
def pie(data,pixel):
    labels = data.index
    sizes = data.values
    plt.figure(figsize=pixel, dpi=80)
    plt.pie(sizes, labels=None,textprops={'fontsize': 14}, autopct='%1.1f%%', startangle=15, pctdistance=0.6)
    plt.legend(loc="upper left",labels=labels)
    plt.axis('equal')  
    plt.tight_layout()
    plt.show()

source.0bf8b74e:
fig = plt.figure(figsize=(12,15), dpi=80)

plt.subplot(2, 2, 1)
car_models=dataset.loc[(dataset['Age']=='18-30')].groupby('Which one among these are your favorite car makers?')['index'].nunique()
_, _, autotexts = plt.pie(car_models.values, labels=car_models.index,textprops={'fontsize': 14}, autopct='%1.1f%%', startangle=15, pctdistance=0.85)
plt.setp(autotexts, **{'color':'white', 'weight':'bold', 'fontsize':12.5})
#draw circle
centre_circle = plt.Circle((0,0),0.5,fc='white')
fig = plt.gcf()
fig.gca().add_artist(centre_circle)
# Equal aspect ratio ensures that pie is drawn as a circle
plt.axis('equal')  
plt.tight_layout()
plt.title('Popularity of Car Brands among 18-35 age group',fontsize=16)

plt.subplot(2, 2, 2)
car_models=dataset.loc[(dataset['Age']=='31-40')].groupby('Which one among these are your favorite car makers?')['index'].nunique()
_, _, autotexts = plt.pie(car_models.values, labels=car_models.index,textprops={'fontsize': 14}, autopct='%1.1f%%', startangle=15, pctdistance=0.85)
plt.setp(autotexts, **{'color':'white', 'weight':'bold', 'fontsize':12.5})
#draw circle
centre_circle = plt.Circle((0,0),0.5,fc='white')
fig = plt.gcf()
fig.gca().add_artist(centre_circle)
# Equal aspect ratio ensures that pie is drawn as a circle
plt.axis('equal')  
plt.tight_layout()
plt.title('Popularity of Car Brands among 31-40 age group',fontsize=16)

plt.subplot(2, 2, 3)
car_models=dataset.loc[(dataset['Age']=='41+')].groupby('Which one among these are your favorite car makers?')['index'].nunique()
_, _, autotexts = plt.pie(car_models.values,  labels=car_models.index,textprops={'fontsize': 14}, autopct='%1.1f%%', startangle=15, pctdistance=0.85)
plt.setp(autotexts, **{'color':'white', 'weight':'bold', 'fontsize':12.5})
#draw circle
centre_circle = plt.Circle((0,0),0.5,fc='white')
fig = plt.gcf()
fig.gca().add_artist(centre_circle)
# Equal aspect ratio ensures that pie is drawn as a circle
plt.axis('equal')  
plt.tight_layout()
plt.title('Popularity of Car Brands among 41+ age group',fontsize=16)

plt.show()
source.c83160dd:
def pie(car_name):
    car=dataset.loc[(dataset['Which one among these are your favorite car makers?']==car_name)].groupby('Provide reason for loving the favorite brand you selected')['index'].nunique()
    _, _, autotexts = plt.pie(car.values, labels=car.index,textprops={'fontsize': 10}, autopct='%1.1f%%', startangle=15, pctdistance=0.7)
    plt.setp(autotexts, **{'color':'white','weight':'bold','fontsize':10})
    #draw circle
    centre_circle = plt.Circle((0,0),0.4,fc='white')
    fig = plt.gcf()
    fig.gca().add_artist(centre_circle)
    # Equal aspect ratio ensures that pie is drawn as a circle
    plt.axis('equal')  
    plt.tight_layout()
    plt.title(car_name,fontsize=12)

source.c4c042da:
def pieprice(p_range):
    labels = p_range.index
    sizes = p_range.values

    _, _, autotexts = plt.pie(sizes, labels=labels,textprops={'fontsize': 14}, autopct='%1.1f%%', startangle=15, pctdistance=0.7)
    plt.setp(autotexts, **{'color':'white', 'weight':'bold', 'fontsize':12.5})
    #draw circle
    centre_circle = plt.Circle((0,0),0.5,fc='white')
    fig = plt.gcf()
    fig.gca().add_artist(centre_circle)
    # Equal aspect ratio ensures that pie is drawn as a circle
    plt.axis('equal')  
    plt.tight_layout()

source.7be2a0f3:
def piehide(p_range):
    sizes = p_range.values
    labels=p_range.index

    _, _, autotexts = plt.pie(sizes, labels=None,textprops={'fontsize': 14}, autopct='%1.1f%%', startangle=15, pctdistance=0.7)
    plt.setp(autotexts, **{'color':'white', 'weight':'bold', 'fontsize':12.5})
    #draw circle
    centre_circle = plt.Circle((0,0),0.5,fc='white')
    fig = plt.gcf()
    fig.gca().add_artist(centre_circle)
    # Equal aspect ratio ensures that pie is drawn as a circle
    plt.axis('equal')  
    plt.tight_layout()
    plt.legend(labels=labels)

source.b2ddbbee:
tech=tech_factors.loc[tech_factors['Which car segment you likes the most']=='SUV']
factor=pd.concat([tech['factor1'],tech['factor2'],tech['factor3']],axis=0,ignore_index=True)
factors=pd.DataFrame(columns=['index','factor'])
factors['index']=factor.index
factors['factor']=factor.values
factors_suv=factors.groupby('factor')['index'].nunique()

tech=tech_factors.loc[tech_factors['Which car segment you likes the most']=='Sedan']
factor=pd.concat([tech['factor1'],tech['factor2'],tech['factor3']],axis=0,ignore_index=True)
factors=pd.DataFrame(columns=['index','factor'])
factors['index']=factor.index
factors['factor']=factor.values
factors_sedan=factors.groupby('factor')['index'].nunique()

tech=tech_factors.loc[tech_factors['Which car segment you likes the most']=='Hatchback']
factor=pd.concat([tech['factor1'],tech['factor2'],tech['factor3']],axis=0,ignore_index=True)
factors=pd.DataFrame(columns=['index','factor'])
factors['index']=factor.index
factors['factor']=factor.values
factors_hatch=factors.groupby('factor')['index'].nunique()

plt.figure(figsize=(14,14), dpi=80)
plt.subplot(3,1,1)
plt.bar(factors_hatch.index, factors_hatch.values, width=.4, color='slateblue')
plt.title('Technical Factors Hatchback',fontsize=18)
plt.subplot(3,1,2)
plt.bar(factors_sedan.index, factors_sedan.values, width=.4, color='orangered')
plt.title('Technical Factors Sedan',fontsize=18)
plt.subplot(3,1,3)
plt.bar(factors_suv.index, factors_suv.values, width=.4, color='aqua')
plt.title('Technical Factors SUV',fontsize=18)
plt.show()

source.3cce9d05:
tech_factors=pd.read_csv('../input/featurescar/features.csv')
factor=pd.concat([tech_factors['factor1'],tech_factors['factor2'],tech_factors['factor3']],axis=0,ignore_index=True)
factors=pd.DataFrame(columns=['index','factor'])
factors['index']=factor.index
factors['factor']=factor.values
factors=factors.groupby('factor')['index'].nunique()

plt.figure(figsize=(12, 6), dpi=80)
plt.bar(factors.index, factors.values, width=.4, color='orangered')
plt.title('Features that are Major Decision elements for Women',fontsize=16)
plt.show()

data=dataset.groupby('As a woman driver, Do you have any concerns on driving bigger models like mentioned below?')['index'].count()
plt.figure(figsize=(14, 6), dpi=80)
piefactors(data.values,data.index)
plt.title('Concerns on driving bigger models\n\n\n',fontsize=18)
plt.show()
source.c4ff2795: # The Kernel contains EDA performed by me on a dataset prepared by my GF as part of her project.
source.68483473:
**Findings** • Suzuki, Hyundai, Tata, Honda and Ford are the top 5 car brands that are the most famous among woman.
• 7 to 10 lakhs is the most attractive price range among women.
• Sedan is the most loved car segment by women followed by SUV. Hatchback is the least preferred model.
• As age increases, women are more interested in the SUV models.
• Women with children prefer SUVs the most while women with no children prefer sedans the most.
• About 9 in 10 women prefer automatic cars.
• Safety, exterior appearance and fuel efficiency are the 3 main technical factors that woman are most interested in.
• Car performance is important among younger woman but not so important among older woman.
• Purchase cost and brand value are the most important non technical factor among women.
• Reverse parking camera and airbags are the most important features that women think are must in cars.
• Majority of woman are open to discussions and recommendation from others while they are looking for purchasing a car.
• Family and friends are the main source of information for women regarding cars followed by Internet.
• Majority women have poor knowledge about engine and performance metrics. Performance is not their priority in car purchasing.
• Majority women have admitted that they are influenced by advertisements and promotional activities of cars.
• Majority women are highly influenced by their family members while thinking of purchasing a car.
• While majority women say that dealership attitude is not important, still a sizeable group of women says that dealer’s attitude is the deal closer for them.
• Petrol is the most preferred fuel type among women while a sizeable group of women exists who don’t have any idea about the various fuel types and their benefits.
• Majority women hate modifications after purchasing.
• Majority woman faces some sort of concern on driving cars while the biggest problem for them is driving bigger cars in city traffic.
